thread.title: Wednesday on Snapchat: Touring the New Photo-Friendly White House - The New York Times
thread.title_full: Wednesday on Snapchat: Touring the New Photo-Friendly White House - The New York Times

author: The New York Times
title: Wednesday on Snapchat: Touring the New Photo-Friendly White House - The New York Times
text:
Continue reading the main story Share This Page Continue reading the main story Continue reading the main story Earlier this summer, Michelle Obama announced the end of a longtime ban on photography during public tours of the White House.
With this in mind, we asked our politics reporter Nicholas Corasaniti to go put on his tourist hat.
See what he sees on Wednesday morning, starting around 8:30 a.m. Eastern, as he makes a Snapchat story live on The New York Times Snapchat (username: thenytimes). You never know who might pop in to say hello.
You can also get updates on Twitter at @NYTnickc and @nytimestravel.
Continue reading the main story Big news! Excited to announce we're lifting the ban on cameras and photos on public tours at the @WhiteHouse ! https://t.co/b0v17puClm
— The First Lady (@FLOTUS) July 1, 2015 Tomorrow: Reporter @NYTnickc morphs into a White House tourist (briefly). Follow on Snapchat (username: thenytimes) pic.twitter.com/IF6oPSobV7
— NY Times Travel (@nytimestravel) Aug. 4, 2015 Loading... Go to Home Page »
